author: siladu
content:
Got a new image with a couple of fixes for devnet-2 https://github.com/ethpandaops/withdrawals-testnet/pull/17/files
- Fix initcode error handling (may have been the cause of besu proposing some bad blocks)
- Fix sync bug found by hive tests

Don't mind if it's updated or not, I just published to checkpoint the devnet-2 fixes vs next devnet changes...

It does not yet include
- gwei change
- latest engine API changes such as V1/V2 error handling, although not sure these would cause a consensus issue

hopefully can get the gwei change done in the next 24 hours

author: marekm3498
content:
guys, I've just noticed 9 unhealthy teku nodes, Is it a known issue?
https://forkmon.withdrawaldevnet2.ethpandaops.io/

author: parithosh
content: Yea, Barnabas was moving around keys to see how many keys we can run on 1 machine without the testnet breaking üòÖ  We hadn't done this check in a while and wanted to just update our estimates.

author: barnabasbusa
content: yeah, sorry forgot to mention in the channel here. We are now successfully running 22k validators on a single teku/geth instance üòÑ

author: barnabasbusa
content: I can update the images, if needed. Does besu need a resync or just a restart?

author: siladu
content: Restart should be fine I think

author: siladu
content:
hmm that doesn't look good `exec /opt/besu/bin/besu: exec format error`
could be a mac m1 issue again with the docker build, although I targeted `linux/amd64` so I'd expect it should work?

author: barnabasbusa
content: Could you try to build on x86?

author: siladu
content:
Sorry I thought I did but can see from the arch here that it didn't work... https://hub.docker.com/layers/siladu/besu/22.10.3-SNAPSHOT-openjdk-11-debug-withdrawals-evm-fbf0e21/images/sha256-c3a67705f9d2d72e3f90eddefad8a8886a399db0031b24ef3f620cfd62a2acd8?context=repo

There must be a bug in our gradle task or something, bear with me. Again, not a blocker for us if this doesn't get deployed, happy to roll back or whatever.

author: bridge-bot
content:
<parithoshj> Could you try buildx? 

docker buildx build --platform linux/amd64 --push -t siladu/besu .

author: siladu
content: we use a gradle task for building. Can that command build from an existing arm image though?

author: parithosh
content:

Which seems to be here: https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/tree/main/docker/openjdk-11-debug

Not sure of the exact build process for besu, but I'd reckon it'd work for that dockerfile (should be there in your branch too)
